description: A non-canon sea located at the start of the New World, known for its extremely bizarre and dangerous weather phenomena. The weather can change from one extreme to another in a matter of seconds, including giant raindrops, hailstones larger than warships, snowfall like an avalanche, and the ocean spontaneously separating to create deep trenches.

keyEvents.title: Final Battle of Z's Ambition Arc
keyEvents.description: The climactic battle between Luffy and Shuzo takes place in the Maubeugemour Sea.
keyEvents.significance: Serves as the battleground for the arc's conclusion.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Leave Maubeugemour Sea
keyEvents.description: After defeating Shuzo and enjoying Panz Fry's feast, the Straw Hats sail away from the Maubeugemour Sea.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the end of the Z's Ambition Arc.

climate: Extremely unstable and dangerous - weather changes rapidly and unpredictably

specialFeatures.description: A scaled-down version of the Knock Up Stream, a powerful upward current that can launch ships into the air
Extreme weather including giant raindrops, hailstones larger than warships, and spontaneous ocean trenches

description: A small island within the Maubeugemour Sea where the Straw Hats, Panz Fry, and Lily take refuge. This island becomes the battlefield for the final confrontation between Luffy and Shuzo.

keyEvents.title: Neo Marines Torpedo Attack
keyEvents.description: Shuzo's men launch themselves as human torpedoes at this island, targeting the Straw Hats and the giants.
keyEvents.significance: Initiates the final battle sequence of the arc.

keyEvents.title: Luffy vs. Shuzo Battle
keyEvents.description: The main battle between Luffy and Shuzo takes place on this island.
keyEvents.significance: Serves as the arena for the arc's climactic battle.

keyEvents.title: Panz Fry's Farewell Feast
keyEvents.description: Panz Fry prepares a magnificent feast on the island for the Straw Hats before they depart.
keyEvents.significance: Provides a celebratory conclusion to the arc and shows gratitude.

statusHistory.reason: Island remains intact after the battle
